title: Everyday English Course 71
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: She wants to take the most direct way.
She may be late for the football game.
She is worried about missing her flight.
instances.correctAnswer: She is worried about missing her flight.

variables.a: What do we learn about the woman from the conversation?

answerOptions: His coach didn't help him enough.
He had no chance of winning.
He didn't follow his coach's advice.
instances.correctAnswer: He didn't follow his coach's advice.

variables.a: What does the man imply?
How many science courses did the woman take in high school?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Tiger Cinema. What can I do for you?
M: Yes. Could you tell me what time the film starts?
W: The film? Ten past nine tomorrow.
{a}

W: Tiger Cinema. What can I do for you?
M: Yes. Could you tell me what time the film starts?
W: The film? Ten past nine tomorrow.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_kz:
W: Tiger Cinema. What can I do for you?
M: Yes. Could you tell me what time the film starts?
W: The film? Ten past nine tomorrow.
{a}

variables.a: What time will the film start?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Hello. I need a room for two days from June 3 to 4. Do you have any spare room?
W: Sorry, sir. We are fully booked on that day. But we do have rooms on June 5 and 6.
M: OK. I book a single room for the two days.
{a}
questionTemplates.text_ru:
M: Hello. I need a room for two days from June 3 to 4. Do you have any spare room?
W: Sorry, sir. We are fully booked on that day. But we do have rooms on June 5 and 6.
M: OK. I book a single room for the two days.
{a}

{a}

variables.a: When will the man check in?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Would it be convenient to see the apartment now?
W: Yes. Come this way,please. This is the bedroom.
M: Maybe it is a bit small. May I see the kitchen?
W: Sure, it is completely modern.
{a}

answerOptions: He has had a heart attack because of smoking:
He is coughing because of too much smoking.
instances.correctAnswer: He is coughing because of too much smoking.

variables.a: What do we know about the man?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: Excuse me, Sara.
W: Yes?
M: I have some difficulty in pronouncing some of the words in the text. Could you help me?
W: Sure.
M: How do you pronounce this word?
W: Travel.
M: Travel. What does "travel" mean, please?
W: It means "go from place to place". For example, I want very much to travel round the world.
M: I see. How about this word?
W: "Explain something" means "make something clear".
M: How do you spell "clear"?
W: c-l-e-a-r, clear. If you want to make something clear to others, you explain it. Are you clear?
M: Yes. You have explained clearly.
W: That's good.
{a}

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What are the man and woman talking about?

answerOptions: He's planning to find a new job.
He prefers to keep his house in a mess.
He's too busy to clean his house.
instances.correctAnswer: He's too busy to clean his house.

variables.a: What can we learn about Tom?
What are they talking about?

questionTemplates.text_en:
M: What have you been studying?
W: Biology and chemistry. I like natural sciences. How about you?
M: I prefer social sciences. I like history best.
{a}

variables.a: What subject does the man like best?
What has the woman decided to do On Sunday afternoon?

questionTemplates.text_en:
W: Hello, Kangkang, why are you unhappy?
M: I can't get a ticket to the football match tomorrow.
W: Maybe I can help you. One of my friends wants to sell his ticket to that match.
M: Really? Thank you very much.
{a}

M: I can't get a ticket to the football match tomorrow.

{a}
